metadata.title: CVE-2019-14744 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In KDE Frameworks KConfig before 5.61.0, malicious desktop files andconfiguration files lead to code execution with minimal user interaction.This relates to libKF5ConfigCore.so, and the mishandling of .desktop and.directory files, as demonstrated by a shell command on an Icon line in a.desktop file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14744` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libkf5config-bin - 5.60.0-0ubuntu2
libkf5config-data - 5.60.0-0ubuntu2
libkf5configcore5 - 5.60.0-0ubuntu2
libkf5configgui5 - 5.60.0-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: kconfig package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.60.0-0ubuntu2').
